intro: Dentella cyclindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical dentella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, cylindrical flower spikes. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
